dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: A weathered, yet serene poster, of a green landscape (Tex fills our frame. We pan around revealing EL CASPER, a gau faced 17 year-old wiping water from his face. He stares a the image with a curious indifference, it’s hard to read he thinks. Behind him a slum like neighborhood of one-story concrete homes that resembles a favela, linked with the familiar m of paths, scavenged roofs and satellite dishes powered by dangerously improvised cables. His cell phone BEEPS. He finishes washing his face and he and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casper walks briskly down the street. People give hima respectful amount of space. We see more details of his bo a tattoo on his neck “perdoname madre mia” and a TEAR DRO on his right eye, the shape of a pistol in his back pocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A combi pulls up to a line of 8 waiting PASSENGERS. Caspe walks past them and sits in the front seat with the drive The driver hands him a wad of CASH, with out saying a wor nor Casper look at him. At the next stop lined with 5 waiting passengers, Casper gets down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casper passes THREE fellow FOOT SOLDIERS of his gang. Lon rifles lean against a wall next to them as they lounge in hot sun watching the border of their territory. He picks one of their bikes and rides down the blocks. He arrives at a corner MINI-MARKET, again silently collec cash from the WOMAN running it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Casper rides a bike through the maze, weaving around pedestrians and vendors.

dialogues.speaker: 1B
dialogues.text: 1c

dialogues.speaker: 2B
dialogues.text: He pauses on his bike. A train passes in front of him. THREE similarly tattooed men ride atop, they acknowledge Casper with nods.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Casper rides into another alley and stops in front of an unremarkable concrete house. A television blasts a Game S inside while an ancient woman, ABUE, cools off next to th window. She eats raisins from a bowl. El Casper takes one and eats it with out asking, charmingly.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Sefiora. She looks at El Casper disapprovingly, then makes an incomprehensible call into the house. A BOY, 12, appears wearing a tattered middle-school unifo He sees El Casper and motions for him to come in. INT. SMILEY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 2B The boy hands him a backpack unceremoniously, it’s an old routine. El Casper checks the contents of the backpack, CD players Gameboys, radios, batteries, headphones, and other random stolen goods. He nods approvingly, then notices a slim DIGITAL CAMERA. He picks it up, inspects it, then stuffs in his own pocket before zipping up the bag. El Casper ho his finger up to his mouth... EL CASPER (CONT’D) Shhh, our secret. The boy nods.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Lil’ Mago wants to see you. EXT. EL LIL' MAGO’S HOUSE, BACK PATIO 3 The KID stands before EL LIL' MAGO, a striking man in his early-twenties, with a face covered in MARA SALVATRUCHA tattoos, crowned with “devil’s horns” scrawled in detail his forehead. About a DOZEN other similarly clad GANG MEMBERS, including El Casper, stand around him. The Kid nervously pulls at his tattered school pants. Lil Mago smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... El Casper and TWO other men, El Smokey, a teen with crazy eyes and EL BOMBA, a hefty Guatemalan in his late-twentie jump up and begin beating the boy. EL SOL, mid-twenties, stoic, watches from behind. The boy tries to fight back, spinning around in a fury of punches and kicks but is no match to the three men’s experience. He is quickly pummeled to the ground. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) ..-Four, five. Five... Five and half... Six... He is knocked again and again, all he can do is protect h face. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) ...nine, ten, eleven, eleven... twelve. El Casper looks at El Lil' Mago, waiting for “thirteen.” Boy’s face is cut and his left eyelid sags. El Casper onl halfheartedly punches him now. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Twelve. El Casper feels El Lil' Mago glaring at him, so he launch kick into the boys chest. The boy YELPS as El Casper kick him over and over. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Thirteen. El Casper finally stops, breathing heavily. Despite his tears, whimpers and quivering body, the Boy forms a smile a crying smile. El Lil' Mago pulls him up. The men HOLLER as they rush in throwing Mara Salvatrucha (MS13) gang signs (”"M” then “S shapes with their hands) and stacking those with their clica’s name “CONFETI LOCOS” in a form of sign-language. They hug him. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Look at this kid, Casper, he’s all smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: We see a large expanse of the capitol and its foothills. city covered with colorful homes, patches of tropical gre and smog. On the bottom of the frame THREE ADOLESCENT GIRLS make th way up a long set of stairs towards us, sharing a cigaret SAYRA, 15, an olive-skinned girl with long hair and brigh eyes stands between CLARISSA and YAMILA.

dialogues.speaker: CLARISSA
dialogues.text: You’re so lucky, Sayra. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my Dad came back to take me north with him...

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Mine didn’t, he was deported.

dialogues.speaker: CLARISSA
dialogues.text: And? At least he can make the journey with you, instead of paying a pervy pollero to take you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yamila’s dad was a pervy pollero, from what her mom remembers. Yamila, cigarette in mouth, gives Clarissa the finger.

dialogues.speaker: CLARISSA
dialogues.text: (to Sayra) Look, I don’t even know why you’re wetting your pants over this, it’s not like your Grandma wants to take care of your ass anymore. And if Orlando goes? You should get the hell out of here while you can.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: (sarcasticly) And leave this?

dialogues.speaker: CLARISSA
dialogues.text: Pendeja.

dialogues.speaker: YAMILA
dialogues.text: I wish I could go with you.

dialogues.speaker: 5A
dialogues.text: Yamila hugs Sayra firmly.

dialogues.speaker: YAMILA
dialogues.text: I’ll pray for you. Sayra and Clarissa continue on, we linger for a moment on Yamila who sadly watches them walk away. She finishes off the butt and drops it to the ground. We pan away from her to catch up to Sayra and Clarissa as they enter their neighborhood, past vendors, CAT-CALLING who they give the finger and soccer playing children. Sayra and Clarissa climb into the room from a window. The laugh as they fall to the floor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --landing on a stained mattress, half covered with a worn flower print sheet in a tiny, sparse room with two other similar mattress on the floor. Clothes, sheets and blanke sit in tidy piles along the walls. ORLANDO, 19, Sayra’s almost equal in age Uncle, waits for in the room. He has kind eyes, but you can tell he’s irritated with her. She reacts, shrugging in a “what do y expect?” kind of way.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: He’s here. Clarissa trips over a BACKPACK. Sayra quickly stuffs it under a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Come on. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a front door you know. Sayra trips Orlando, sweeping his back leg just as he stumbles into the NEXT ROOM, a compact concrete space tha doubles as a kitchen and a bedroom. The girls try to cont their laughter before entering. Sayra pauses, her mood shifts, she looks nervously at Clarissa. To comfort her, Clarissa presses their foreheads together... The next room -- serious faced Sayra looks around, an old woman, NANA, glares up at her. Lying on a blanket covered couch, her sick eyes guide us to a some seats where Orlan sits down abruptly, next to his pregnant girlfriend, CECI 19, and... HORACIO, mid-thirties. Bushy eye-brows and weathered fac mid-conversation with Nana. He sees Sayra, his eyes redden as he stands, sniffing and wiping his nose gruffly. Sayra stops in the doorway, Clarissa hovers behind her. Horacio opens his arms, gesturing for her to hug him.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: If I didn’t know I wouldn’t recognize her. Sayra stays in the doorway, crosses her arms and waits.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Go on. Horacio indicates again he’s waiting for her to hug him.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: (trying hard) You're all... like a real woman. She relents, approaches and sticks out her hand, in a cordial, but cold handshake. Horacio reciprocates warily.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: She's done nothing but talk about you. Appalled and embarrassed, Sayra retreats.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: You'll have lots of time together, now.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: I wish Mami, but with Yessenia alone with the kids... we’ll leave tomorrow on the congolén.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: So Soon? You can’t stay longer? (to Sayra) You packed?

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: Then you better get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go. This comes as a shock.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: The hell you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: I never said I'd go for sure. The entire room breaks into noise.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: It’s what’s best.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go with him. Do you want me to leave, Nana? The old woman doesn’t exactly say no, it’s pretty clear s rather the girl left. Sayra looks around the room. The attention and pressure infuriates and hurts her. Sayra walks out of the house. Suddenly Clarissa is left behind, awkwardly, in the room -- she turns and looks at Orlando. EXT. TAPACHULA TRAIN YARD (AKA LA BOMBILLA), MEXICO — DAY The train yard, populated with about 50 CENTRAL AMERICAN IMMIGRANTS, has four tracks and an abandoned passenger platform. El Casper and the boy, now known as SMILEY, sit on the platform. El Casper, visibly bored, watches over the immigrants like a shepherd. Smiley copies Casper whenever adjusts his sitting position. LUCRESIA, a transvestite with boxer shorts hiked up over tight T-shirt and a bucket balanced on her head saunters She has a sassy sense of humor with rapid-fire responses anyone who makes a comment to her. She notices Smiley -- the “new” member and makes a sarcas comment. Casper ignores her but notices she is also selli COLORFUL FELT FLOWERS from a plastic bag. His cell phone BEEPS. He pulls out the phone. Text messag ONDE STAS? He stuffs the phone back in his pocket, eager seems, to move.  Casper whistles at Lucresia, calling her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Casper and Smiley walk across a metal bridge spanning oily creek filled with garbage. On the other side FOUR kids fish despite the pollution. O of them is drawing an MS13 “X3” on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Casper! They jump up and flash the gang’s sign. El Casper kicks o of them in the butt then hurries on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to climb through the window of a simple looking story house, but stops and turns around to Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: How long? El Lil' Mago said we were supposed to stay in La Bombilla-

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: -Not long. He climbs into the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 15 year-old girl, MARTHA MARLEN, lies sleeping on a cou Casper admires her peaceful, smooth face, sleepy eyes, sweating beading on her forehead. He gently sits down next to her and leans forward, but be he can kiss her she awakens, laying out a barrage of slap and catching him by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Stop it! What are you doing? He grabs her flailing hands and forces her back, falling top of her.  10

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Get off of me.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: You going to calm down?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: You better get off of me or I’1l scream, I swear to God I will. Faking like she’s going to scream, El Casper covers her m with his. They give each other one long wet kiss. MARTHA MARLEN (CONT’D) I still hate you. El Casper reaches around to his back pocket and pulls out nylon flowers. Martha Marlen’s eyes light up. She takes the flowers and pushes El Casper off of her, disappearing into the living room/kitchen. He can hear her fiddling with a bucket of water.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: (El Casper yells to her) They don’t need water. She comes back in holding the flowers in the cup.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: I know. She sets them down next to her bed. El Casper watches her adoringly. She catches him, smiles, then pulls off his hoodie and shirt all at once. His body is covered in the same tattoos as El Lil' Mago: three points of la vida loca on his hand, a rosary around wrist, “perdoname madre mia” on his neck and over his hea still raw “Martha Marlen.” He hugs her tight, breathing in her scent, then pulls her down to him and rolling on top of her. They kiss again. EXT. MARTHA MARLEN’S HOUSE - DAY 10 Smiley tries to look through the window but can barely ho himself up long enough to see El Casper and Martha Marlen moving sexually on her bed.  11 10. He slips down, he eagerly tries to pull himself back up, is too weak from the baptism. He sits down, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sayra watches the movements of the city from this vantage point. Orlando approaches her from behind. She says nothi to him. He sits down quietly, appreciating the view.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: They're going to build a golf course there. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like golf?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: I’ve never played.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Me neither. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand why you’d want to do this trip. I’m not sure yet if I understand why I should. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ve just gone along, bad shit happens and I just go along with it. Just like your baby and Ceci will have to, with out you.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: If you want to stay, Nana won’t force you to go, but...

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: I don’t care. I don’t need him. I could go north on my own if I wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Good, then send me money when you get there. You're fifteen Sayra, you really think you could do this on your own? It’s dangerous, you've heard the stories. You need a coyote, you know how much that costs? She shrugs.  12 11.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Come with us. I know it won’t be easy there either, but at least you'll have us. There’s nothing for you here. Nothing. She grinds the ground with her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: If I went, it wouldn’t be for him and it wouldn’t be for you neither. It would be for me. I’d make my own decisions.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Alright, then I’1l think about it. You can tell him that. The first sharp BRASS notes of “CANCION MIXTECA” played b ragged brass band key-noted with a MARIMBA echo over the of a river... EXT. SUCHIATE RIVER - GUATEMALA -— DAY 12

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Left side SUPER: TECUN UMAN, GUATEMALA Right side SUPER: CIUDAD HIDALGO, MEXICO Nothing more than a brown, 200 yard wide river divides th two countries. We pan down from the landscape to a birds- perspective of the river. The source of the key notes in the music floats onto screen... A MARIMBA (looks like an oversized xylophone) played by TWO MEN on a raft made of intertubes and wooden palettes. FOUR similar rafts float into view. The ones moving right are cramped with people -- the ones moving left, product. BOYS with long poles push the rafts forward. We move towards one of those rafts with people, where everyone except for Sayra stares eagerly at the coming Mexican shore. She stares at the surreal looking MARIMBA raft.  13 14 12. Horacio sits on the front of the raft. His bushy eyebrows drip sweat as he joins Orlando in prayer.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: ...Amen. Horacio crosses his chest and looks back at his daughter, seems to ignore them both. Their raft wobbles before it hits the shore, she clenches wooden boards, her knuckles whiten. Horacio steps off and turns to help Sayra, but she still sits with her back to them, frozen. He turns and walks away along with Orlando. Sayra notices they aren’t waiting for her. She stands awkwardly and run to join them. EXT. CIUDAD HIDALGO —- CONTINUOUS 13 Sayra catches up to Horacio and Orlando, who stand frozen front of TWO JUDICIAL POLICE OFFICERS.

dialogues.speaker: JUDICIAL OFFICER
dialogues.text: Welcome to Mexico. Papers? The officers grab the three of them by the neck and force them into a concrete building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL other nervous IMMIGRANTS sit on the floor in fron another JUDICIAL OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: (whispering) Don’t worry, we'll be okay. SAYRA and ORLANDO do not look convinced. They are petrifi

dialogues.speaker: JUDICIAL OFFICER
dialogues.text: Okay, friends, first you will empty your pockets of any and all forms of money and valuables. Then you will take each item of clothing off and place it on the floor in front of you. Start with your shoes. They hesitate. Judicial Officer #1 knocks an IMMIGRANT MA in the head.  15 13. They all strip quickly to their underwear as the Judicial Officers rifle through their clothes, cutting open seams opening their bags to collect their money. Horacio looks at his cut clothes with steaming anger. Embarrassed, Sayra covers herself as best she can. INT. MARTHA MARLEN’S BEDROOM —- DAY 15 Martha Marlen and El Casper (known as Willy to her) lay h naked in bed. El Casper takes photographs of her with the digital camera. Martha Marlen is shy, she holds her hands defending herself from the lens, but secretly is amused w it. El Casper adjusts the BLACK STRINGED NECKLACE wooden tabl with SAINT ANTHONY*** skirting her collarbone, then snaps another. He lays down next to her to inspect the photos. Her finge caresses his tattoos while he figures out how to replay t images.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Willy, will you give me one, too, one with your name on it?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: No? Why not?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: You want to look ugly like me? She rolls over, sighing...

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: I like you just the way you are.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: I’m bored.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: We never go out, we never do anything, just this. Take me somewhere?  16 14.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Anywhere. Some place you like... somewhere you go when you’re not here.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Why go out? When we’re together, we got all we need in the world, right here.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Do you have another girl in your hood?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: What? No. Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: If I find out you do, I swear to God... Martha Marlen makes a scissors sign with her hand, lookin down at his privates. She giggles.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: You're shrinking! El Casper looks down at his privates and shrugs. He turns little red, but overcompensates when he says...

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: It’s natural. It’1ll come back. He pins her down and starts kissing her again, quickly snapping another photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s late in the day as El Casper and Smiley walk back in Colonia Confeti.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: So, does she have a friend for me? Casper stops Smiley, searching for intent in his face, as he meant it as a threat.  17 15.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: You can’t ever tell Lil' Mago I take you to that house, understand? No one can know.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (intimidated) Okay-

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: -Not a fucking word. Casper lightens up on him.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: We'll get your cherry popped. Not just with a diecioyo, but with a girl, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horacio leads a startled, if not more vigilant, Orlando a Sayra in a fast march along an irrigation ditch in a gree field. Their clothes are stretched and their shoes cut up The air is filled with flies, mosquitos and other annoyin pests. Sayra slaps her own neck and moans.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: We got it.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: I said we got it. Horacio stops and looks at them sternly.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: You need to know this number, in case anything happens, Yessenia will help you.  18 19 16.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: How much more, carnal?

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Six hours, maybe more. Orlando looks back at Sayra, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: This is an adventure little brother, we are adventurers. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy or hard, we go on. Horacio marches on.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Now, say the number again. EXT. EL LIL' MAGO’S HOUSE, COLONIA CONFETI - DUSK 18 In the cramped alleyways of the colonia, El Lil' Mago’s h hums with REGGAETONE BEATS. The front yard somehow fits t moth-balled carcass of an older model American car. Children pretend to drive inside.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Welcome to the destroyer. INT. EL LIL’ MAGO’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 19 It’s a grimy home of small, concrete rooms, poorly organi and stuffed with detritus. The walls look like the grimy tile of a subway bathroom, the rooms contained stained mattresses and improvised furniture. As El Casper greets the inhabitants, all respond with the "S" hand signs.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: Sup Casper? Did he get a chavala* yet? (diecioyo, 18th Street Gang*) El Bomba stands over a two range counter top stove warmin corn tortillas. Opened cans of vegetables litter the counter. A teenage girl, KIMBERLY, helps him prepare the food.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: No.

Smiley takes in the space while nervously touching the scabbing marks on his face. He gestures to EL SMOKEY and EL PICARO ironing their clot with their shirts off. They are covered in tattoos. EL CASPER (CONT’D) (whispers) El Smokey and El Piqaro. They got in today from San Salvador. Thirsty? El Casper grabs a TAMPICO from a watery bucket in the kit and hands one to Smiley while leading him deeper into the house, there are girls, and at least FOUR LITTLE KIDS who belong to them walking about. EL TURBINO, a skinny Mara, lays over a chair as El Pelugu applies a tattoo to him. A cigarette dangles from his mou EL CASPER (CONT’D) El Turbino. ‘cause he smokes like one... EL PELUQUIN stands over El Turbino, hunched like a scare- crow.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-And El Peluquin. He can’t sit down ‘cause he’s bleeding from the ass. Hemorrhoids. They cross a patio to another room containing a TV and pa for building pipe guns, machetes, bats, chains and other sundry weapons. At the end of the room, an alter to an unknown Saint is adorned and candled. Smiley points at a chimba, a home-made pipe gun.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: When you earn it. For now, you share like everyone else, what’s from La Mara is for la Mara. In the back room, El Sol catches a glimpse of El Casper, nods to Lil’ Mago. EL CASPER (CONT’D) El Sol, is the segunda palabra. El Lil' Mago plays with his kid while his girl, DIANA, 18 nags him in one ear. The girl doesn’t stop nagging, even when he gets up to greet El Casper and Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: My boys have arrived!

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Sup Lil' Mago?

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: How'd he do? Casper shrugs, El Lil' Mago looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: (to Smiley) You went to La Bombilla?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Yeah, we didn’t see nothing. El Lil' Mago eyes El Casper sadly, then turns his attenti back to Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Well, I got a little something for you anyway, Smiley. He leads them back to THE BACK PATIO past a broken SHREK PINATA on the ground. Candy rappers lay scattered about. ONE YOUNG CHILD sits amongst the trash, poking around for fresh piece of candy. El Lil' Mago burps his kid, who is starting to pass out o his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Wait here. El Lil' Mago and El Casper disappear down a darkened alle Smiley stands by himself uncomfortably, TWO MAREROS play “paper, rock, scissors” while another is dry-humping a gi in a darkened corner. THREE KIDS, the same ones who were fishing on the bridge, watch from the top of their neighboring shack. They notic Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Oh! Benito? How’d you get in there? Smiley looks up at them. They are the same kids from the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: My name is Smiley now... Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: No way? Holy Cow! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how’d you get in there?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: I’m a marero, stupid. Smiley shows them his bloodied knuckles. They look impressed. El Casper comes back, motioning for Smiley to follow. Smiley throws the “M-S” sign to the kids, they si back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Casper leads him through the colonia to a dimly lit sh El Lil' Mago opens the door and turns on his flashlight. Inside a beaten IMMIGRANT is tied up, his face covered in coagulated blood. Smiley looks disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: El Sol found him today amongst a group of pollitos... in La Bombilla. El Casper flashes a look at El Lil' Mago, who lifts up th man’s shirt, revealing an XVIII tattoo (18th Street) acro his stomach. He looks at El Casper and Smiley, amused. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) This is Mara-land pinche chavala-

dialogues.speaker: BLEEDING IMMIGRANT
dialogues.text: (crying) I told you, I don’t do that shit no more. Please. I’m just going north.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: After we kill you, we’re going to cut you up into 18 tiny pieces and feed you to our dogs. El Lil' Mago raises his pistol. The man writhes like a wounded snake to avoid the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: BLEEDING IMMIGRANT
dialogues.text: Please, I have a family, I don’t do that shit no more...  20. Smiley smirks nervously at the man. El Casper is stoic, h knows what is about to happen and he doesn’t want to do i He’s sick of it. El Lil' Mago hands him a snub nose .38 SPECIAL. Smiley is surprised. He motions to himself as if to say “who me.”

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Once a diecioyo always a diecioyo, Smiley. Help him Casper. Smiley can only stare at the gun, his heart races. El Cas takes it, cocks it, then places it carefully back in Smil hand.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: (patiently) We'll do it together. Okay? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim for his head. Smiley nods, mentally preparing himself, but his knees sh his stomach queasy. They raise their weapons, El Casper gently adjusts Smiley’s nervous aim, positioning it over man’s body. El Lil' Mago covers his child’s ears. EL CUERVO (CONT’D) BLEEDING MAN On three... Please, for the love of Jesus-— (BEAT) (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one, two, three- Fuck you, mierdaseca, fuck you... Smiley closes his eyes as El Casper first, then he, open fire. The flashes illuminate their faces. El Casper kneels down and listens. The man still breathes Blood floods towards their feet. Smiley, only wearing fli flops, backs up to avoid it. El Lil' Mago rub’s Smileys h playfully. Smiley is green. EL LIL’ MAGO Watch the blood run, Smiley. You did that. Casper reloads his chimba with another shotgun shell, coc it...  21 22 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-BANG. Casper’s shot echoes across the train yard -- illuminated by the fading light of day and the radio towe that casts a blue-green glow over it’s four tracks and abandoned passenger platform and station. Horacio, Orlando, and Sayra stumble in, exhausted. They t in the space: 150 HUNDRED IMMIGRANTS meander in the yard, huddling in groups, sitting on the tracks and chatting. Some look exhausted like Sayra and her family, some look scared, so look outright scary. Various MEN stare at Sayra and make comments - she’s a st out. Horacio glares at them, then steers her protectively towards the abandoned platform. Suddenly, the ENTIRE CROWD moves, like a school of fish avoiding danger. Horacio turns to see what everyone is fleeing from. It’s nothing, TWO STATION SECURITY GUARDS w SHOTGUNS. Those closest calm down. Some, who ran, are already a hundred feet away. Horacio and Orlando breath a sigh of relief. Lucresia, observing the movements of the crowd, laughs with another LOCAL about how the immigrants move like a school of fish An IMMIGRANT snaps at her, she snaps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando helps Sayra up onto the concrete ledge of the abandoned station. He pulls her shoes off. She winces fro the pain. Her feet are swollen and blistering. ORLANDO (CONT’D) You just walked too much today. Sayra winces again as he places his bag under her calves.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Let them air out.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: We'll buy her some water.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: We have no money.  22. Horacio pulls out a small TOOTHPASTE tube from his backpa He screws off the lid and with a string, pulls out a smal twist of PESOS and US DOLLARS. Both Orlando and Sayra are surprised. Horacio, pleased with himself, hands Orlando the pesos. HORACIO (CONT’D) Two big bottles. Horacio looks at Sayra’s feet. He reaches to touch them-

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: -No-no-no. He reaches for her foot again.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Horacio sits in an awkward silence next to his daughter, staring at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Your second toe is longer than your big one. Sayra looks at her feet self consciously. HORACIO (CONT’D) That means you’re a fast runner. He pulls out a FOLDED XEROX MAP of Mexico. HORACIO (CONT’D) Look. This is how far we got today. See... He places his finger at their position on the SOUTHERN BO OF MEXICO with GUATEMALA, tracing along a RAIL LINE that traverses Mexico to the NORTH-EASTERN border of MEXICO... HORACIO (CONT’D) ...if la migra* (Border Patrol*) don’t get us, we’ll be here in two weeks-—

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Two weeks, chucha?!

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Maybe three.  23. ..-his finger arrives at a town called REYNOSA, south of Brownsville, Texas. HORACIO (CONT’D) There... we cross.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: New Jersey?

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: It’s not on the map. He looks at her, she seems pale. HORACIO (CONT’D) Are you nervous? About the trains? Bandits? Sayra seems lost in thought. Horacio motions to the HUNDR of Immigrants around them.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Not half these people are going to make it. (he let’s this sink in on her) But we will. He puts the map in his wallet. A picture of a woman peeks out. Sayra pulls the picture out: a WOMAN holds TWO littl GIRLS, 4 & 5, with Horacio smiling behind them. The photo only reminds her of who her father has been spending his ten years with. She doesn’t like it. HORACIO (CONT’D) Yessenia’s not as pretty as your mother was but she has a good heart. Horacio notices a WOODEN BRACELET on Sayra’s arm with ima of SAINTS.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Pretty girls.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Thank you. He takes the picture back and looks at it longingly. He f it over and caresses a ladies handwritten note, “vuelve pronto.” He notices Sayra still looking at the photo.  24.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep it. They’re your family now, too.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: I don’t want a picture of your family. She gently pushes the photo back towards him. He puts it back in his wallet. HORACIO (CONT’D) I don’t expect you to just forget everything that’s happened, but I would like you to try to understand I did what I had to do.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Horacio, we don’t need to act like other fathers and daughters, we don't even need to be friends, okay? We’re adults, as far as I’m concerned, you’re taking me with you, I’m grateful. Orlando throws Horacio the bottle, who pops it open and h it to Sayra.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Here. Lucresia saunters by, announcing her products with a lazy drawl...

dialogues.speaker: LUCRESIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tortillas, soup, coffee...

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: I’m going to call home. He walks towards the impromptu cafe where other immigrant are lined up to use the phone. Orlando yells after him...

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: 9-0-8-5-5-5-0-1-8-7 Then break into laughter together.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: I remember him handsomer.  23 25.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Ah, no. I’m the handsome one in the family. Sayra smiles. ORLANDO (CONT’D) So, ain’t so bad, is it? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t act like you’re not a little bit happy.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: If he wasn’t deported we wouldn’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: That don’t matter anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: It does to me. EXT. EL LIL' MAGO’S BACK PATIO - DUSK Smiley sits by himself. He seems sick and slightly bewildered. El Lil’ Mago sits down next to him, rubbing h neck in a brotherly way. EL LIL’ MAGO The first time is like that. You'll feel better, you’re part of a family with thousands of brothers. Where ever you go, there'll be someone to take care of you. Smiley nods, he stares at the child playing in the candy rapper trash, then at TWO DOGS eating a bowl of raw MEAT BONES. El Bomba comes out of the house with tortillas, a bowl of vegetables and beans. Kimberly follows him with the bucke of soda.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: Eat. El Lil' Mago rises, grabs a tortilla and rolls it in his hands, joining El Casper smoking a cigarette. Casper hand the butt to El Lil’ Mago to share. Lil’ Mago holds his ki on his lap.  26. EL LIL’ MAGO Hungry? El Casper shakes his head. His cell phone BEEPS. He looks at it, another text from Martha Marlen: Vienes o no? . He stuffs the phone away. EL LIL’ MAGO Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Dunno, no Caller ID. EL LIL’ MAGO I hate that, you know, when people don’t show their numbers? It’s really impolite. El Lil’ Mago studies El Casper’s response, he nods. Caspe finishes off the cigarette and scrapes it out. The embers flare as they die. Everyone in the yard stuffs their mouth.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: El Sol didn’t see you today, in La Bombilla.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: We must have just missed each other.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: El Peluquin and Turbino are doing dishes tonight.

dialogues.speaker: EL TURBINO
dialogues.text: Eh, we did them yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: And I cooked yesterday... so? You going to have our guests do them? El Turbino looks at Pigaro and Smokey shyly. His food han on the side of his mouth. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) (to El Casper) So, El Sol didn’t see you and it took four days to find a chavala for Smiley? (he pauses, searching Casper’s face) (MAS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 27. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT'D) (continuacién) It’s cool, I don’t know, I guess I just miss seeing you more, carnal. Remember the old days? In Brownsville, we used to kick it like royalty. El Casper half smiles, wistfully. EL LIL’ MAGO Sometimes I wish we could just go back to those days. El Lil' Mago gives El Casper a drunken kiss on his forehe then puts his toddler on El Casper’s lap. He strolls acro the patio and grabs Kimberly. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Casper, you look like shit, man. Smile sometimes. He motions to some of the other girls in the yard, before dragging Kimberly into his room. El Casper stares into Li Mago’s baby’s drooling face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Casper and Martha Marlen are perched in a 30 foot towe basket overlooking the train yard. The city lights twinkl in front of them. Down below, Smiley throws pebbles at the ground, visibly bored. El Casper videos her with the camera...

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Stop. He looks disappointed, hiding behind the camera. Her fing lazily caresses his ankles... MARTHA MARLEN (CONT’D) What’s wrong? El Casper turns the camera off.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Nothing. Why? We’re out of your room, aren’t you happy? She doesn’t have an answer, she just senses it. He kisses her on her mouth until she has to push him away to breath He grabs her breasts with one hand, unzips her pants with other.  28. MARTHA MARLEN (CONT’D) No. Just hold me. El Casper sighs, then lays down on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Why do you guys hang out here?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: ‘Cause.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Why do you care?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Dunno.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: We been doing this for months and you ain’t never asked so many questions, until recently.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I guess I just wonder what you do all day?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Nothing interesting. Martha Marlen hesitates before asking him...

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Willy... you kill people? He stands, looking over the sea of immigrants in the trai yard below.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Never? You can tell me, you know.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Not people... chavalas* and sometimes stupid ass immigrants. If they’re uncooperative bad things happen. It’s their own fault. He notices her thinking about what he just said.  29.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: See this train here? This is our train. What would you say if I said that you and I should get on it right now and take it all the way to Texas? Have you ever been to Texas?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: You know I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: There’s this spot on the highway to Houston, a gigantic field of flowers, and the sky is all blue with puffy clouds. It looks like the cover of a magazine. Martha Marlen leans on him.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: We could go to Six Flags.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: I have school in five hours, stupid. Somehow the rejection hurts him. He plays it off...

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: I know... I’m just playing. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Tell me you love me.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Tell me you’re going to stop hiding me.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: I don’t-

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: You do, you hide yourself from me.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: You know all there is that’s worth knowing about me.  25 30. Feeling that he’s blocking her out again, her temper flar She climbs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Casper follows Martha Marlen down to the base of the tower. Smiley sits at the bottom, smoking a cigarette. Martha Marlen storms past him.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Wait. MARTHA MARLEN (CONT’D) (to El Casper) You think I don’t know what you do? All day with your friends? Partying with girls, fucking around and stuff. Martha Marlen looks at him, waiting for a response. El Casper’s attention drifts 0.S. Out of the darkness, El Sol approaches them, flanked by F others.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: El Casper, Smiley. El Casper freezes.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Sol, sup carnal?

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: Sup.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Sup, Sol. El Sol takes Martha Marlen in with his eyes, appreciating beauty.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: Who's this? El Casper motions to Martha Marlen.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Martha Marlen, El Sol -- El Sol, Martha Marlen.  31. Martha Marlen greets El Sol with a certain amount of apprehension, he shakes her hand. El Sol looks at her but addresses El Casper.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: She your jaina (girl*)?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: She's... a friend. Martha Marlen looks at El Casper trying to suppress her surprise. El Sol looks between them both, then at Smiley, who looks at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: We're having a parla tomorrow in the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Word.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow, then.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Word. El Sol starts to turn and walk away, then spins around.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch your backs. It’ll bea packed train tonight, you never know who might be lurking in the crowd. El Sol spins walks into the darkness of the yards. El Cas turns to Martha Marlen.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: I’m taking you home.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: ‘Friend’? El Casper feels the daggers from her eyes. He grabs her a She pulls away. MARTHA MARLEN (CONT’D) Let go of my arm.  26 32.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: (to Smiley) Is it okay if I crash at your house tonight? Smiley nods.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Wait here, then. El Casper runs to catch up with Martha Marlen, disappeari into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (mimicking El Casper) Wait here Smiley. Wait here. In the distance, the ghostly WHISTLE of a coming train ec from the darkness. Smiley sits back down and starts throw pebbles again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horacio reaches to wake Sayra, but she is already up, her eyes red from an unrestful sleep. El Sol and his Maras walk past them. Horacio keeps a wary eye on them. Orlando notices them too. He takes out a photograph of CE and kisses it before placing it in the bible while keepin his eyes on them. Again the WHISTLE echoes out of the darkness. Chaos ensue 300 IMMIGRANTS hustle to find their groups. Another WHISTLE blasts even louder. Sayra watches the far end of the tracks. The FREIGHT TRAI emerges from the darkness, bathed in the blue-green glow. It’s a gigantic two-engine, 30 car beast, already covered with 100 HUNDRED IMMIGRANTS. It glides into the train yard with a STOMACH SHAKING RUMB dividing the yard in half as it comes to a halt. Horacio grabs Sayra’s and Orlando’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Don’t let go.  27 33. Fighting against the movement of the crowd towards the gr cars, Horacio plunges into the fray. A high-pitched POP and WHOOSH blasts from the breaks. Doz of immigrants flinch, jumping away from the wheels of the train in a wave. Horacio climbs the ladder to the roof of a car and disapp leaving Sayra and Orlando below. They are pushed around b others, waiting of Horacio to reappear. His head peeks over the edge and waves urgently for Sayra Orlando to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sayra and Orlando heave themselves up over the edge and w towards the center of the car. They are at least two stories high in the air, flanked by DOZEN IMMIGRANTS on the top of one car. Sayra clasps Orlando’s hands without realizing it. Around them immigrants run back and forth, yelling across cars. The engine clanks into reverse, pushing cars into e other, then settles. A silence settles over the yard as t hundreds of immigrant wait. Down at the back of the train, in the darkness at the end the station, an IMMIGRANT yells to Lucresia to bring some her food over...

dialogues.speaker: LUCRESIA
dialogues.text: (yelling back) Hell no! You come here. If I go down there they’1ll break my ass. DONALD, forties with frazzled hair and a round face, poke his head over the top of the box car.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: No train. Derailed upstate. Dozens killed. Horacio turns towards him.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Where did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Others. No train North tonight, maybe not tomorrow either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 29 34. They look at each other, commiserating. Horacio slaps his hat in frustration. Down the line of the train, the passi of the word “no train” is met with moans of disappointmen Lucresia calls out that her “shop” is still “open”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleeping immigrants lie in uncomfortable groups all o the yard and train. INT. SMILEY’S HOUSE - MORNING 28 Smiley’s walls are decorated with magazine pages of carto characters and soccer stars. El Casper sleeps on the floo while Smiley quietly looks through the photos on his digi camera. He is visibly intrigued by the pseudo-naked pictu of Martha Marlene. Abue opens the door. She looks like a living corpse, thin and fragile.

dialogues.speaker: ABUE
dialogues.text: Benito, go and get tortillas. Casper sits up groggily, wiping his face. She notices Cas sleeping on the floor, mutters to herself, then disappear Casper notices the camera in Smiley’s hands. Enraged, he snatches it out and stuffs it in his pants.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Don’t ever touch that again. It’s mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horacio is surrounded by Sayra and SEVERAL other laughing amused immigrants. They all pay attention to Horacio, who has a handfull of stones.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: 60 Lempiras.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: What am I going to do with Lempiras?  30 35.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Wipe your ass. Horacio laughs. He readjusts his baseball cap, like a pitcher, then takes the stones and fires off three stones PLASTIC BOTTLES some thirty feet away. Each one falls dow The Immigrants gasp impressed.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Do it again. Horacio quickly fires of three more stones at the reset plastic bottles. The Immigrants are doubly amused. Horacio holds out his h to collect the lempiras. Donald pays up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Bomba, El Smokey, El Pigaro, El Casper and El Smiley w 80’s rock ballad music videos on a television with a high improvised antenna system. Visible in another room, Lil’ Mago and El Sol discuss something quietly. soL It’s hard, but you’re the Primera Palabra. You got to be the example, the meanest, the illest, that’s why you are respected. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something I didn’t have, jomi, that’s why I and the Barrio chose you. Casper looks at them, but Sol shuts the door. El Bomba brushes his teeth, when he’s done he gives the toothbrush to El Bomba. When he’s done he'll give it to E Smokey, and so on until Smiley... MARIA and Kimberly sit around Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: (to Smiley) Smiley, do you wear anything else besides your school uniform? They laugh at him.  31 32 36.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Ah, it’s cute. Maria ruffs up his hair.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (shyly) My Grandma hasn’t done laundry yet. El Turbino pulls off his shirt and throws it to Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: EL TURBINO
dialogues.text: You can have it. Smiley looks at the shirt, excited, it’s a nice button up Kimberly sits between El Bomba and El Casper. She whisper their ears...

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Don’t let your friend kiss her. She motions to Maria, who flirts with Smiley wearing his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: She just gave El Sol a blow job. El Casper looks at El Bomba. Both of them watch Smiley. Maria kisses him on his ear as he fumbles to brush his te After he puts the toothbrush down, they begin to tongue e other. El Turbino and El Bomba can’t contain their laught El Sol and Lil’ Mago enter the room. EL LIL’ MAGO Meeting. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Casper, Smiley, El Lil' Mago, El Bomba and about THREE DOZEN of El Lil' Mago’s clica of Mara Salvatruchas walk across the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maras sit in a circle. El Lil' Mago is finishing up speaking...  37.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: ...We still need more cash to buy food and supplies for our homies in prison. We could also use cash for El Serpiente’s Mom who’s sick and needs medicine... Lastly, some of our homies are failing at their responsibilities. The fucking diecioyo's are right on top of us, none of you can be sleeping... there will be cortes for this. Casper, Smiley, you lied to me. Casper looks up, surprised. EL LIL’ MAGO Where'd you go? After La Bombilla? Smiley looks back and forth between Lil’ Mago and Casper. EL LIL’ MAGO Smiley? Where’d you guys go? Smiley’s frozen. Unable to decide whether to lie or tell truth. EL LIL’ MAGO That’s what I thought. Both of you will receive cortes. That’s it for now. La Mara por vida. The rest of the Maras raise their hands, “la mara por vid Smiley, completely confused, looks around him for answers but no one talks to him. Out of the corner of his eye El Casper catches sight of something and double-takes. It’s Martha Marlen lurking behind a tomb. He doesn’t know how long she was there, bu she didn’t just show up. She walks towards him with a hint of self-consciousness. jumps to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: (hushed) What the hell are you doing here? Martha Marlen smiles and kisses him, noticing the girls, every one else for that matter, staring at her. EL CASPER (CONT’D) You need to leave. Now.  38.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Why? (at the girls) Private party? El Casper grabs her by the arm and starts to walk her out but El Lil' Mago cuts them off. El Lil' Mago looks straig at Martha Marlen.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: A friend. Martha Marlen notices Kimberly and Maria staring her down

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: From Las Guacas?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: (insulted) Parque Hidalgo. Next to the Cacahuataén colectivos.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Oh. My bad.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: I was just going to show her out.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: No. Uh uh.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Come on. EL LIL’ MAGO I can show her out. Or she can wait and watch. Which do you prefer? You’re not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: (peering hard at Lil’ Mago) Show her out. Quickly. El Lil' Mago turns his back to El Casper and walks Martha Marlen away. She looks back at him confused. He watches h go.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Carnal, you ready?  33 39. His attention snaps back to El Sol.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: What? El Casper stares at El Sol, there is a moment of cold understanding between them. Realizing his error, he whips around back towards Martha Marlen -- but she has disappeared. WHAM. It’s as if the GROUND comes up to meet his face. El Bomba stands over him. Others jump in and start beating h He jumps to his feet again, fighting to get away.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 26 second corte for lying... One... two... three... El Casper fights back, punching and kicking his attackers Smiley watches confused. El Sol turns to him...

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You too, Smiley. 13 second corte for lying with Casper. Smiley looks up in shock just as he’s knocked in the face SEVERAL Mareros kick him over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Lil' Mago walks Martha Marlen down the hill past a gigantic trunk of a Ceiba tree, some twenty feet in diame On the other side, out of view from the others, El Lil' M stops. He sits down on one of the giant roots.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: This is the tallest tree in the forest. If you climbed to the top of this one, you could almost see China.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: Why couldn't Willy come?

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Willy? You mean El Casper?

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: (self consciously asserting herself) Willy.  40. El Lil' Mago eyes her.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Ah... I get it. You’re the reason he’s been missing. (he laughs to himself) Sit. I want to talk to you. She sits. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Closer. He pats the tall root, beckoning her closer. She looks around, uncomfortably. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Don’t worry, I won’t bite. She moves in a couple of inches. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) So you and El Casper aren't just friends. Are you? El Lil' Mago puts his hand on Martha Marlen’s leg. She lo as if her stomach is turning into knots.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA MARLEN
dialogues.text: I have to go. El Lil' Mago rubs her leg, slowly moving higher.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: How much time you guys spend together? Martha Marlen is frozen. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) You know what the most important rules are in maintaining friendships? El Lil' Mago moves in closer, right near her face. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Honesty... He grabs her breasts. A wave of fear washes over Martha Marlen. He breathes in her smell around her neck.  34 41. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) .--and generosity. She pulls away as he kisses her neck, but he holds onto h She tries to break free but he reaches around her and pul her in. She pushes him, he pushes back. She jumps back against the tree, but El Lil' Mago grabs h in a chokehold, ripping her NECKLACE off. He holds her in a chokehold and brings her to the ground, unzipping his pants. She struggles with all her might, but El Lil' Mago overpo her and holds her tightly. He turns her over, pulls at he pants, gets them down. She struggles to find a grip, his wraps around her face. She bites him so hard he bleeds, letting her go. She tries crawling away, dazed, trying to find an escape, Lil' Mago kicks her from behind. Her face slams into the ground hard, piercing her temple on a broken gravestone. El Lil' Mago stands over her, realizing he may have gone far.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Hey? Hey? You okay? He rolls her over, she’s gone. He’s upset, like a dog who knows he’s done wrong. He sits down next to her, catching his breath, rationalizing. He notices her necklace on the ground and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Casper, holding his belly, slowly makes his way down a of grave stones. Lil’ Mago appears out of the darkness an walks past him.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Where’s Martha Marlen? Lil' Mago doesn’t answer. He sits down next to a fire. Hi mood is somber, his tone cold and hard.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: She’s gone.  42.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Home?

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Devil took her. These words register on El Casper’s face. His emotions strangle his heart in a vice as he tries to contain himse EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) You’1l find another. El Lil' Mago stretches. El Casper can’t contain himself anymore, his eyes squeeze tears. El Lil’ Mago notes it, b it’s unclear if he feels remorse. El Casper starts to hea into the darkness, searching... EL LIL’ MAGO Wait. Lil’ Mago motions him over to Smiley, who cries on the gr ten feet away from him, throbbing with fresh wounds. El L Mago kneels down next to him. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Smiley... El Lil' Mago hands Smiley a Chimba. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) Here. This is yours now. Take care of it. Smiley grasps the chimba, confused by the gesture but exc by the gift. El Lil' Mago pats his head. He turns and fac Casper... EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) We're going on a little trip to Tondla. You, me and Casper. A little family vacation. El Lil' Mago smiles at Casper genuinely, unzips his pants pisses on a mausoleum. EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) One more thing, carnal, lie to me again and I will kill you. El Casper’s eyes tear. He looks out into the darkness, wh he lost Martha Marlen.  35 36 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train yard is filled with 300 IMMIGRANTS waiting for train to move again. Sayra and Horacio eat canned refried beans and tostadas. look exhausted as they stuff their faces. Horacio watches as Sayra separates the beans from the ric from the meat, then eats one section at a time. She picks the seeds from a pepper and scrapes them off her plate.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Your Mom didn’t like chile either. Sayra turns her bracelet on her wrist. HORACIO (CONT’D) Did she give that to you? Sayra shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: She used to wear one like that. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought it for her in the Coahuitas market when I was courting her.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: I know. Horacio laughs to himself, seemingly lost in memories. Suddenly movement erupts down the line. Orlando runs up t them.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Thank be to God... the tracks have been cleared. The train’s leaving tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above, the massive freight train is covered wit human bodies. It pulls forward slowly, each car yanking o the next in one long clanking succession. Sarya, Horacio, and Orlando clamor for a position on top box car. The train cars hammer into each other again as t train picks up speed.  37 38 39

Sayra’s eyes are wide with uncertainty as she watches the blue light from the radio tower pass over them and toward the back of the train. Horacio pulls her and Orlando into him, holding them like two kids. Suddenly they are enveloped in darkness. Anxiety tickles spine, the hair rises on her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Lil' Mago, El Casper, and Smiley get ready to jump abo El Casper is bent over, nauseous. He watches El Lil' Mago the dark, a bitter hate in his eyes. As they jump aboard immigrants distance themselves as bes they can. They know quite well who they are and what they can do. Smiley looks around excited. He’s never been on a train before. He looks at Casper, but he is locked in an adrenaline drained trance.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: The train in full daylight is packed with people, like a gigantic conveyor belt snaking through lush farmlands. Sayra drinks the last few drops of water from their bottl Everyone on the car is hot, sweating, and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Aguas. They duck as the branches of a tree brush over them.

dialogues.speaker: CHIAPAS COUNTRY-SIDE 39
dialogues.text: The train crosses the humid landscape, passing in front o abandoned village and a church, half buried with dirt and covered in a tall grass.  40 4l 42 43 45.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN TRAIN CARS 40
dialogues.text: El Lil' Mago, El Casper, and Smiley refuse tortillas offe by the immigrants next to them. Lil’ Mago pulls out their own food and disperses it to Casper and Smiley. El Casper holds the food, but he doesn’t eat it. Ina trance, he stares at the passing ground just underneath t His eyes are red. Smiley points to Casper’s food. He hands it to him withou looking. Smiley stuffs it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: NORTH CHIAPAS COUNTRY-SIDE 41
dialogues.text: The sun begins to set as the train curves around a mounta Just west, a great lagoon reflects the orange light of th sun. Above it, storm clouds brew, casting a dark shadow across the mountain and Eastern sky.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF BOXCAR 42
dialogues.text: Sayra, Horacio, and Orlando look tired, sun burned and thirsty. The sky opens up and pours down rain. Horacio taps Orland

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Pull out the plastic. Sayra pulls it out of Orlando’s backpack first, while sev of the other immigrants pull out garbage bags, with holes out for their heads and arms. Horacio and Sayra spread out what looks like a plastic ta It covers at least FIVE people. Others pull out similar sheets and connect theirs with Horacio’s, using their han to hold the seams together.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE PLASTIC 43
dialogues.text: TEN hot and wet immigrants, including Sayra, Horacio and Orlando huddle together with their plastic sheets coverin them. Orlando and Sayra laugh as they try to form a water tight seam with the two sheets.  44 44n 45 46 47 46.

dialogues.speaker: IN BETWEEN TRAIN CARS 44
dialogues.text: Soaking wet, El Casper notices a sign demarcating in TONA KM. Suddenly, the heavy iron train cars slam into each other, like thunder rolling down the line of cars, noticeably slowing the train down. The train shutters to a stop, creaking and wheezing, brea popping. They are stopped somewhere in the dense greenery Nothing but the rain drops and creaking train can be hear El Lil’ Mago taps El Casper and Smiley. They pull out the weaponry; Smiley has his new chimba, El Lil' Mago a .45 Pistol, and El Casper a machete. El Lil' Mago nods a theatrical “goodbye” to the immigrant next to them, then climbs up to the TOP OF THE BOXCAR. EL CASPER, distracted, climbs up last. El Lil' Mago points at a mound of immigrants hidden under sheet of plastic. Lil' Mago points at them. He signs them to “lift up” the plastic on his signal.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE PLASTIC 45
dialogues.text: Sayra and Orlando laugh as they drink up the leaking wate Horacio’s face is sprayed with water as they re-roll the pieces together.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF BOXCAR 46
dialogues.text: El Lil' Mago gives them the signal. They rip it off.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Your fucking money, now! FIVE unsuspecting immigrants scream as they digest the sh of being surrounded by armed Mareros. They hurriedly empty their pockets.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE PLASTIC 47
dialogues.text: Sayra, Orlando, and Horacio sit calmly; it’s not them. Sa takes a big gulp of water and spits it on Horacio.  48 49 47.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF BOXCAR 48
dialogues.text: An immigrant MAN empties his pockets. His eyes are filled with an indigestible panic as he avoids El Casper’s dark stare. The water comes down so hard that the drops make i seem as if he’s crying. Smiley and El Lil' Mago hand money to El Casper, but he’s paying attention. Smiley taps El Casper. He wakes up and places the money into a SMALL BOX. Smiley shakes with excitement, intoxicated with the new power. He pushes the barrel of his chimba into the same man’s temple, studying his reaction with pleasure. El Casper looks at Smiley; the boy is learning quickly. El Lil' Mago turns and leads them to the end of the car, scanning the immigrants who stare at him with terror. He makes a running jump to THE NEXT BOXCAR. There, ANOTHER GROUP OF IMMIGRANTS huddle under plastic. El Casper jumps across next, his feet slip on the wet roo but El Lil' Mago catches him. He smiles at El Casper, throwing his arm over his back. Smiley hesitates... He’s afraid to jump. Annoyed, Lil’ Ma continues on. Casper watches him with contained contempt.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE PLASTIC 49
dialogues.text: Suddenly, light and water pour down on Sayra, Orlando, an Horacio, like a hurricane has ripped off the roof of thei temporary house. SHRIEKS of fear scatter in the wind and rain. Sayra closes her mouth tightly as the water pounds her fa Horacio grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: The fucking money, now. El Lil' Mago kneels down in front of Sayra. He notices he

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: (to Orlando and Sayra) Empty your pockets! Empty them, now!  48.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Casper , spit in my face if she don’t look like a mini Salmita? El Lil' Mago jams his pistol into her jaw and forces her towards Casper. Dread fills Horacio’s face, he pleads wit Lil' Mago.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Please! Horacio automatically grabs El Lil' Mago’s shoulder. He smacks Horacio in the head with the pistol, knocking him a daze.

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Everyone turn around. Everyone, including Sayra, Horacio, and Orlando turn arou EL LIL' MAGO (CONT’D) (to Sayra) No, not you, baby. Sayra trembles as she turns back around, she looks over h shoulder at Orlando and Horacio, but they are turned with Smiley’s chimba pressed against their heads. Sayra looks at El Casper, her eyes plead with him, he loo away. She begins to break down, the fear coursing through her body, she screams for help...

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: No, please! No! Papi!

dialogues.speaker: EL LIL' MAGO
dialogues.text: Take her down with us. Horacio holds his bleeding head. Orlando prays aloud, crying. We move towards El Casper as time and sound imperceptibly slows... He stares at Sayra, who’s eyes plea to him for help. Then at Smiley, who is just now climbing onto their train car. Smiley takes in the scene, the scared immigrant’s faces, Horacio’s bleeding head, Sayra under Lil’ Mago, an Casper’s departed stare. El Lil' Mago gropes Sayra’s body. She resists, he smacks back of her head.  49. The train cars creak, then the distant slamming of cars g loud again. This time as the train pulls forward, down th line, the rolling boom awakens El Casper from his stupor. drops the BOX of money, it tumbles off the train. El Lil' Mago sees this, he turns towards El Casper curiou just in time to see... El Casper’s machete bearing down on him, slicing two inch into his neck and severing his jugular. El Lil' Mago star at El Casper in confusion, his face quickly losing color. Casper hacks twice more. Blood sprays over Sayra as El Lil' Mago grips his gushing neck and collapses onto her. She kicks him off her violently. Smiley, still holding the chimba to Horacio’s head, notic El Lil' Mago’s slumped body. His eyes dart up to El Caspe dumbfounded. El Casper snatches the chimba out of Smiley’s hands and g him, as if he were going to throw him. He looks into Smiley’s scared eyes but cannot hurt him. H let's go of him and backs up. His hands shake as he determines the next course of action.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Get off the train, Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Casper? Orlando and the others look at El Casper and Smiley. The train is moving swiftly again.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER
dialogues.text: Go! He looks at El Lil' Mago’s dead body, its legs twitch. El Casper nudges it. It falls under the wheels of the train disappears. Smiley is still frozen. EL CASPER (CONT’D) (beginning to cry angrily) He killed Martha Marlen. Smiley looks at him in confusion again.

dialogues.speaker: EL CASPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go home Benito! Go back to your Grandma.  50

dialogues.speaker: 50A
dialogues.text: 51 52 53 50. Smiley retreats down the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley makes a cross on his chest and jumps off the train His feet pedal fast but his momentum topples him, * rolling him several times down the train’s road bed to a path. The train passes by rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sayra moans an exhausted cry. El Lil' Mago’s blood washes down her face in drops of rain. Orlando and Horacio reach out to her...

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Did he hurt you? Horacio tries to hold her, but she pushes him away. From this moment on, EL Casper is no longer El Casper, he become the civilian WILLY and will be described as such. Nauseated, WILLY stumbles to the other end of the boxcar vomits, placing the chimba and the bloody machete next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped. Smiley stands above El Lil' Mago’s body lying in a puddle of blood and water. His eyes are o and his skin is blue/gray, his left leg is gone, ripped o at the hip and his other leg is twisted 180 degrees in th other direction. Flies and mosquitos buzz around his head Smiley digs around his clothes, pulls out his cell phone. checks it, it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped and the sky is clear. Sayra is quiet She trembles from the cold and wet clothes. On the other end of the car, Willy sits by himself. Horacio, Orlando, and several other immigrants whisper inaudibly to each other, all we hear is...  54 55 56 51.

dialogues.speaker: IMMIGRANT 1
dialogues.text: We are riding with the Devil. He’ll curse us all. They keep their eyes on Willy, unaware that he knows they watching him. THREE IMMIGRANTS present themselves in fron of Horacio, offering CIGARETTES and a COUPLE LOLLI-POPs f Sayra. Horacio accepts the gifts.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF BOX CAR
dialogues.text: Tears begin to drip down Willy's face. He breaks down but makes no noise, as if he were crying on mute.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF BOXCAR
dialogues.text: Horacio’s eyes are red, but they are wide and wary. He lo down at Sayra. She holds herself to stay warm. Orlando covers her with the plastic bag and leans in to whisper to her.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Sayra turns away. With her back to Horacio and Orlando, s watches Willy cry. Horacio turns on a FLASHLIGHT and scans the ground next t the tracks. All along the train OTHER IMMIGRANTS do the same, DOZENS of flashlights scanning for bandits, Migra, Mareros, like WWII air-raid search lights, only here they pointed at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn. The car is divided into two sides, Willy on the fro side and the rest of the FORTY immigrants jammed on the o half. Everyone is awake, including Horacio and Orlando (lollipo in mouth), watching Willy. He sits on the edge of the car with his legs dangling over the edge, his eyes half-close He struggles to stay awake, wary of the immigrants watchi him, but sleep overtakes him. THREE IMMIGRANTS from the night before motion to each oth Two have their farming tools, machetes wrapped in plastic protective sheathes. The other scavenges a large rock formerly used to hold down his tarp.  57 52. They creep towards Willy quietly, ready to attack. Sayra gasps awake between Horacio and Orlando, both of wh intently watch what is about to go down. Slowly... Sayra realizes what they are doing. They close on Willy, she points out to the horizon, at first unable speak, she repeats herself until she finds her voice, suddenly screaming...

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: Migra! Everyone, including Willy and the THREE attackers look at her, then where she’s pointing. Willy looks at Sayra -- then the attackers. He understand their intent and grabs his chimba. The element of surprise is lost, they retreat back to the side of the train car. Meanwhile, the entire train comes alive as others pass th word, screaming...

dialogues.speaker: IMMIGRANTS
dialogues.text: (telephoning down the train) Migra! ... Hundreds scramble to their feet, ducking and scanning the horizon. Some point out to the side, searching for a glim of the raid. Others ready to jump. Horacio and Orlando look where Sayra is pointing, but the cannot see anything. There is no Migra raid. The THREE immigrants who were going to attack Willy sit n Horacio and Sayra, they stare at her suspiciously. Horacio and Orlando look at her, she looks straight back them, unflinching.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF TRAIN CAR
dialogues.text: Willy stands up. On the car in front of him, a group of immigrants stare at him. Willy looks at them and they immediately look away. He turns and looks behind him. The same effect happens with the group on his car. Only Sayra holds his stare.  58 53. He looks down at the rails passing beneath him, flirting the sensation of falling. He closes his eyes, feels the a rushing around him. His balance waivers, he opens them ag and turns to see if Sayra is still staring at him. She is Orlando and Horacio check in with each other, wondering w he is doing. Willy kneels down and picks up his chimba; he looks aroun him, at the immigrants who pretend like they’re not looki at him, then tosses it off the side of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train is stopped. Horacio, Sayra, and Orlando eat mor tortillas and beans from a can. Without anything else to drink, immigrants collect bracki water from an irrigation ditch along the tracks with empt soda bottles. Donald offers Sayra a sip. She declines.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: It’s clean.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: It looks like Kool-aid. Donald sticks the bottle of water to his eye and stares i it like a kaleidoscope.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: (smiling) Clean. He grabs his shirt, wraps it around the opening and drink through it like a filter. He pulls out a small box from h pocket and shakes it like a rattler.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we get sick, I have pills. He rubs his stomach soothingly. Sayra takes the water, wraps her shirt around the top and takes a few sips. She looks at Willy, still in the same place. She grabs a scrap of newspaper, wraps a couple tortillas in it with b and starts to climb up the train, Horacio grabs her arm..  59 54.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: Sayra. She yanks free and keeps climbing. Horacio spits. HORACIO (CONT’D) We’re cleaned out, and she gives him our last...

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Be patient with her. Horacio is visibly frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Can’t Yessenia send money? Horacio shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HORACIO
dialogues.text: No, we’ll have to make it to the border on our own, then she can wire the money for the crossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy sits by himself. His cell phone beeps again. It’s E Sol: GREENLIGHT. You’re dead. The BATTERY warning signals as well. Willy stuffs the phone away, digesting the news. With Willy only a few feet away, Sayra whistles through h teeth. Willy doesn’t move. She inches closer, Willy spins around, his hand lingering over his MACHETE. He recognize her. Sayra holds her free hand up, places a tostada with beans her lollipop between them. He relaxes, but only slightly.

dialogues.speaker: WILLY
dialogues.text: Thank you. He stretches his other arm out and grabs the food. Donald climbs up to the top of the car. Noticing Sayra an Willy together, he situates himself closer to Willy’s sid the train, while maintaining a liberal distance. TWO others follow his lead, extending themselves over mor space of the boxcar. Then, more of the group suddenly spr out, fed up with the divide of the car, Horacio and Orlan included. 59  60 55.

dialogues.speaker: SAYRA
dialogues.text: My name is Sayra. He hesitates at first, about to say “Casper”.

dialogues.speaker: WILLY
dialogues.text: Willy. Saying it, instead of “Casper” fills Willy with remorse. That part of him is dead now. Sayra retreats back to her side of the train car. Alone, Willy eats furiously while keeping a watchful eye on the immigrants around him. INT. EL LIL' MAGO’S HOUSE - DAY 60 The Maras are packed into the living room, most cry. El S speaks into a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: (to El Bomba) -.-I’m almost out of credit. Call D.F. with yours. (back into the receiver) Yes, on the train.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: (to Smiley) I don’t understand how you let him go? El Sol hands his phone away.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: Because Smiley is a little bitch... We'll find Casper. We’1l find him and cut him up into small pieces.

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) I’m no bitch... I came back.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Levanten la garra. Mara Salvatrucha... They raise their hands in front of their faces, making th “devils horns” with their index fingers for 13 SECONDS, t drop them.  56.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: We need to elect the a new Ranflero. Who does the Barrio choose? With out hesitation the members call out Sol’s name. He looks around gravely, it is not what he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright. Alright, I accept. Now... El Casper. El Sol scratches his chin in pained thought.

dialogues.speaker: EL BOMBA
dialogues.text: We should all go, get him now.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: We can’t. Not with all the pinche chavalas on top of us. We’1l loose everything? No. We spread the word. Even if we don’t find him immediately, he has no where to go. He’ll pop up eventually. And when he does-

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: -I’m no bitch...

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: You're lucky I haven’t shot you already Smiley... you’re not a true Marero. For all we know you helped El Casper escape. Is that what happened? Huh? Huh!?

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: (fear coursing threw him) No, no. I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
dialogues.text: I’m going to banish you from the colonia. Smiley sinks into a barely perceptible despair, but somew inside him, a response to the fear is formed, anger. He tries to find the voice for it...

dialogues.speaker: SMILEY
dialogues.text: Don’t banish me. Please. El Sol opens himself up for Smiley to hit him. Smiley doesn’t budge.  61 57.

dialogues.speaker: EL SOL
